data.title: Complete Johnny Depp Movies List [Ranked Guide]
data.meta_description: This Johnny Depp movies list is your ultimate guide to the career of Hollywood's most fascinating actor. Which movie ranks the highest?
data.text:
John Christopher “Johnny” Depp II is a true Hollywood icon, renowned for his electrifying performances and his ability to bring even the most unconventional characters to life. From the quirky and off-beat to the dark and brooding, Johnny Depp’s filmography is simply unparalleled.

But where do you even start with a career as extensive and diverse as Johnny Depp’s? That’s where this comprehensive Johnny Depp movies list comes in. We’ve compiled the best films Johnny Depp has ever starred in. Read on as we also take a closer look at his acting style and the roles that have made him a true legend of the silver screen.

So, whether you’re a die-hard Johnny Depp fan, or you’re just discovering his work for the first time, this Johnny Depp movies list is your ultimate guide to the career of one of Hollywood’s most fascinating actors. Get ready to be transported into a world of thrilling performances, eccentric characters, and pure, unadulterated movie magic.

10 Highest-Grossing Johnny Depp Movies

Johnny Depp’s films have generated billions of dollars in revenue at the box office. As a result, he is widely recognized as one of the most successful actors of his generation. This section provides a list of the top 10 highest-grossing films of his career.

Movies Box Office Gross “Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man’s Chest” (2006) $1.066 billion “Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides” (2011) $1.045 billion “Alice in Wonderland” (2010) $1.025 billion “Pirates of the Caribbean: At World’s End” (2007) $960 million “Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl” (2003) $654 million “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory” (2005) $474.9 million “Alice Through the Looking Glass” (2016) $299.4 million “Dark Shadows” (2012) $245.5 million “Public Enemies” (2009) $214.1 million “Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street” (2007) $153.3 million

Top 10 Highest-Ranking Johnny Depp Movies

Discover the best of Johnny Depp’s filmography with our rundown of his top 10 highest-rated movies. This comprehensive analysis uses IMDb ratings and Rotten Tomatoes audience scores to determine which of Johnny Depp’s films have been the most well-received by audiences and critics alike.

1. “Edward Scissorhands” (1990)

“Edward Scissorhands” is a Tim Burton masterpiece that’s earned its place among the standout entries on the Johnny Depp movies list. In this film, Johnny Depp stars as the eponymous character, a creation of an inventor who was left unfinished with scissors for hands.

The story unfolds in a quaint suburban neighborhood where Edward is taken in by a kind-hearted Avon saleswoman. Despite his unusual appearance, Edward quickly wins over the townspeople with his innocence and gentle spirit. However, as his Scissorhands lead to mishaps and misunderstandings, he eventually retreats back to his isolated mansion on the hill.

Johnny Depp’s portrayal of Edward Scissorhands is nothing short of captivating. With his delicate movements and soulful eyes, he brings a touching vulnerability to the character that will warm your heart. This film showcases Johnny Depp’s range as an actor and cements his place as a Hollywood icon.

So, if you’re looking for a film that blends Tim Burton’s imaginative storytelling, the quirky charm of Johnny Depp’s performances, and a heart-warming tale of love and acceptance, “Edward Scissorhands” is a must-see on any Johnny Depp movies list.

IMDb rating: 7.9/10

Rotten Tomatoes audience score: 91%

2. “What’s Eating Gilbert Grape” (1993)

“What’s Eating Gilbert Grape” is a touching and memorable film that deserves a place on any Johnny Depp movies list. Johnny Depp stars as Gilbert Grape, a small-town grocery store clerk who feels suffocated by the mundane routines of life.

The story revolves around Gilbert’s life in Endora, Iowa, where he lives with his mother, who is severely overweight and housebound, and his two younger siblings, one of whom has a developmental disability. Gilbert dreams of escaping his responsibilities and starting a new life, but his plans are interrupted when a mysterious and free-spirited traveler named Becky (played by Juliette Lewis) comes to town and turns his world upside down.

Johnny Depp’s performance as Gilbert Grape is nothing short of phenomenal. With his subtle and nuanced acting, he brings a depth of emotion to the character that allows audiences to connect with him on a deep and meaningful level. This film showcases Johnny Depp’s ability to bring life to even the most complex of characters.

So, if you’re a fan of family tales, the complexities of small-town life, or just want to see Johnny Depp at his finest, “What’s Eating Gilbert Grape” is a must-see on your Johnny Depp movies list.

IMDb rating: 7.7/10

Rotten Tomatoes audience score: 89%

3. “Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl” (2003)

In “Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl,” Johnny Depp stars as the eccentric pirate captain, Jack Sparrow.

Jack Sparrow is a cunning and resourceful pirate, always ready with a witty one-liner and a clever plan up his sleeve. He faces off against the fearsome Captain Barbossa and his pirate crew, who have been transformed into immortal, undead skeletons by the cursed treasure. With the help of blacksmith Will Turner and the Governor’s daughter, Elizabeth Swann, Jack sets out to break the curse and reclaim the treasure.

Filled with action, adventure, and plenty of Johnny Depp’s signature humor, “Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl” is a swashbuckling adventure you won’t soon forget. So hoist the Jolly Roger, and get ready to join Jack Sparrow and his motley crew on a wild ride through the Caribbean seas.

IMDb rating: 8.1/10

Rotten Tomatoes audience score: 86%

4. “Donnie Brasco” (1997)

“Donnie Brasco” is a crime drama that stars Johnny Depp in the titular role of Joseph D. “Donnie” Brasco, an FBI agent who goes undercover in the mafia.

As Donnie, Johnny Depp portrays a man torn between his loyalty to the FBI and his growing attachment to the members of the Mafia. As he becomes more involved in the criminal underworld, Donnie must navigate a dangerous and unpredictable world while keeping his true identity hidden.

Throughout the film, Johnny Depp’s portrayal of Donnie is both captivating and emotional, as he conveys the internal struggle of a man caught between two worlds. As the story progresses, Donnie’s relationships with both the FBI and the mafia become increasingly complex. However, Johnny Depp expertly balances the character’s intelligence, charm, and vulnerability.

In short, “Donnie Brasco” is a must-see film for fans of Johnny Depp’s work and anyone who appreciates a well-crafted crime drama. With its taut storytelling, dynamic performances, and powerful themes, this film is a standout entry on the Johnny Depp movies list and an unforgettable cinematic experience.

IMDb rating: 7.7/10

Rotten Tomatoes audience score: 89%

5. “Finding Neverland” (2004)

“Finding Neverland” tells the story of playwright J.M. Barrie and his journey to finding inspiration for his greatest work, “Peter Pan.” This enchanting movie is a testament to Johnny Depp’s versatility and range as a performer.

In this film, Johnny Depp shines as Sir James Matthew Barrie, a struggling playwright who finds himself at a creative crossroads. He befriends a family of four boys and their beautiful, widowed mother, and it is through his relationship with the children that he discovers the magic of imagination and the power of storytelling. Johnny Depp’s portrayal of Barrie is both touching and humorous, as he captures the playwright’s childlike wonder and whimsical spirit.

As Barrie navigates the ups and downs of his personal and professional life, he embarks on a journey of self-discovery, learning to believe in himself and the stories he wants to tell. With the help of the boys, he creates a world of magic and adventure, bringing “Peter Pan” to life on the stage and inspiring countless generations with the timeless tale.

Overall, “Finding Neverland” is a charming and uplifting film that is sure to capture your heart. Get ready for a journey to the magical world of Neverland.

IMDb rating: 7.7/10

Rotten Tomatoes audience score: 87%

6. “Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street” (2007)

“Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street” is a dark and twisted musical tale that will have you humming its haunting melodies for days. Johnny Depp stars as the eponymous Sweeney Todd, a barber who returns to London after a long absence, seeking revenge against those who wronged him. With his trusty razor in hand, Sweeney sets out to exact his revenge through a series of bloody slayings, all the while maintaining a seemingly normal life as a barber.

In this gory and macabre musical, Johnny Depp takes on the role of the vengeful Sweeney Todd with aplomb. He brings a level of intensity and passion to the character that is both thrilling and terrifying. With his piercing eyes, razor-sharp cheekbones, and striking vocal performance, Johnny Depp’s Sweeney Todd is a force to be reckoned with, making this film a standout on the Johnny Depp movies list.

As Sweeney Todd’s body count grows, he forms an unlikely partnership with Mrs. Lovett (played by Helena Bonham Carter), a down-on-her-luck baker who has a taste for human flesh. Together, the pair create a delicious and sinister business, selling meat pies made from Sweeney’s victims to the unsuspecting citizens of London.

“Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street” is a mesmerizing and darkly comedic musical. With its memorable music, gripping storyline, and top-notch performances, it’s no wonder that this film is considered a classic on the Johnny Depp movies list.

IMDb rating: 7.3/10

Rotten Tomatoes audience score: 81%

7. “Sleepy Hollow” (1990)

“Sleepy Hollow” is a gothic horror film that tells the story of Ichabod Crane, played by none other than the versatile Johnny Depp. In this spooky tale, Ichabod is a quirky and inquisitive detective sent to Sleepy Hollow to investigate a series of mysterious beheadings. With a unique style and unorthodox approach to detective work, Ichabod quickly finds himself in over his head as he uncovers a dark and supernatural conspiracy.

Johnny Depp’s role as Ichabod Crane in “Sleepy Hollow” is a standout performance. Furthermore, the role showcases his versatility and ability to bring humor and nuance to even the darkest of characters. Depp’s quirky, offbeat portrayal of Ichabod is a highlight of the film and is sure to leave audiences both amused and frightened.

“Sleepy Hollow” is a must-see for fans of the Johnny Depp movies list and anyone who enjoys a good spooky tale. With its eerie atmosphere, quirky humor, and standout performances, it’s no wonder that this film remains one of Johnny Depp’s most well-regarded and beloved movies.

IMDb rating: 7.3/10

Rotten Tomatoes audience score: 80%

8. “Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man’s Chest” (2006)

“Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man’s Chest” is an action-adventure film that is an integral part of the Johnny Depp movies list. Johnny Depp stars as the eccentric and charismatic pirate Jack Sparrow, who finds himself pursued by an undead pirate known as Davy Jones. Jack must find the key to unlock Davy Jones’ chest and save himself from a lifetime of servitude aboard the ghostly ship, the Flying Dutchman.

Throughout the film, Johnny Depp’s portrayal of Jack Sparrow is a standout performance, as he brings humor, charm, and a touch of craziness to the character. With his distinctive accent and mannerisms, Jack Sparrow becomes one of the most memorable characters in the Pirates of the Caribbean franchise. As Jack embarks on a dangerous journey to find the chest, he encounters a host of other pirates and sea monsters, each of whom presents new challenges and obstacles.

Ultimately, “Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man’s Chest” is a thrilling and entertaining film that showcases Johnny Depp’s talent as a performer and underscores his importance on the Johnny Depp movies list. With its fast-paced action, stunning visuals, and memorable characters, it remains a fan favorite and a classic of modern pirate movies.

IMDb rating: 7.3/10

Rotten Tomatoes audience score: 72%

9. “Pirates of the Caribbean: At World’s End” (2007)

“Pirates of the Caribbean: At World’s End” is an action-packed pirate adventure film that features Johnny Depp in his iconic role as Jack Sparrow. This movie is a must-watch for fans of Johnny Depp’s films, as well as those who enjoy epic pirate tales.

The film opens with Captain Barbossa (Geoffrey Rush) and the crew of the Black Pearl rescuing Jack Sparrow from Davy Jones’ Locker. Meanwhile, Elizabeth Swann (Keira Knightley) and Will Turner (Orlando Bloom) set out on a quest to gather the Nine Pirate Lords to release the goddess Calypso from her human form and defeat Davy Jones and the East India Trading Company.

Johnny Depp’s performance as Jack Sparrow is, as always, the highlight of the movie. He brings his signature humor and swashbuckling charm to the role, making him one of the most memorable characters on the Johnny Depp movies list. Throughout the film, Jack must navigate treacherous waters and outwit his enemies in order to survive and save his friends.

“Pirates of the Caribbean: At World’s End” is a must-watch for fans of Johnny Depp’s films, and is sure to be a timeless classic in the world of pirate adventures.

IMDb rating: 7.1/10

Rotten Tomatoes audience score: 72%

10. “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory” (2005)

“Charlie and the Chocolate Factory,” which is included in the comprehensive Johnny Depp movies list, is a 2005 musical fantasy film based on the classic children’s book by Roald Dahl. The film follows the adventures of a young boy named Charlie Bucket, who wins one of five golden tickets hidden inside Wonka chocolate bars. The tickets allow Charlie and the other lucky winners to tour Willy Wonka’s mysterious chocolate factory and taste its incredible creations.

Johnny Depp stars as Willy Wonka, the eccentric and reclusive owner of the factory, who has remained hidden from the public for years. Wonka is a fascinating and complex character, and Johnny Depp brings a unique and quirky performance to the role. Throughout the film, Wonka takes Charlie and the other children on a tour of his magical factory, testing their character and revealing their true nature.

Johnny Depp’s performance as Wonka adds to the film’s charm and appeal, and his portrayal of the character has become an iconic part of the Johnny Depp movies list.

IMDb rating: 6.7/10

Rotten Tomatoes audience score: 51%
